abstract.t: The existing DTLS-SRTP specification allows SRTP keys to beestablished between a pair of SRTP endpoints. However, when thereare more than two participants in an SRTP session, DTLS-SRTP isunable to provide a single key for all of the participants. Thisexisting limitation of DTLS-SRTP prevents deploying DTLS-SRTP incertain scenarios.This document describes an extension to DTLS-SRTP called KeyTransport (KTR). This extension transports SRTP keying material fromone DTLS-SRTP peer to another, so the same SRTP keying material canbe used by multiple DTLS-SRTP peers. This extension eliminates theneed to key each SRTP session individually, allowing cost-effectivedeployment of several DTLS-SRTP scenarios.
